section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: hourly rate (按小時收費率) means the rate per hour calculated in accordance with section 8;

office hours (辦公時間) means the hours between 8:30 a.m. and 5:45 p.m. on Monday to Friday, excluding general holidays within the meaning of the General Holidays Ordinance (Cap. 149); (35 of 1998 s. 5; L.N. 82 of 2016)

surveyor (驗船師) means— (L.N. 82 of 2016)(a)a person appointed under section 5(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369) to be a Government surveyor; or(b)a person appointed under section 110 of the Merchant Shipping (Seafarers) (Working and Living Conditions) Regulation (Cap. 478 sub. leg. AF) to be a Government surveyor; (L.N. 82 of 2016 and E.R. 5 of 2018)

tons (噸) means gross tons, and in the case of a ship having alternative gross tonnages, the larger of those gross tonnages, as calculated in accordance with the Merchant Shipping (Registration) (Tonnage) Regulations (Cap. 415 sub. leg. C).

subsection.content: Subject to section 5(1), the fees prescribed in the Schedule shall be payable in respect of the matters specified in relation thereto in that Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees for services within Hong Kong
section.content: Where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon the carrying out of any survey or inspection within Hong Kong during office hours, any fee prescribed by this Regulation shall include the services of a surveyor together with any travelling or other expenses involved.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Fees for services outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon any survey or inspection to be undertaken outside Hong Kong by a surveyor sent from Hong Kong for that purpose, there shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee calculated in accordance with subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the travelling and subsistence expenses of the surveyor in such reasonable sum as the Authority shall determine.

subsection.leadIn: For any survey or inspection described in Part I or IV of the Schedule, the fee payable shall be— (L.N. 82 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the fee for the services is entirely determinable by the time involved, the sum of $7,645, in lieu of an hourly rate, for each period of 24 hours or part thereof during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong on account of the survey or inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the fee for the services is not determinable by the time involved, the sum of $15,290 for the whole period during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong on account of the survey or inspection, and in addition, the relevant fee, if any, specified in Part I or IV;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the fee for the services is partly determinable and partly not determinable by the time involved, the aggregate of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the services determinable by the time involved, the sum of $7,645 for each period of 24 hours or part thereof during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong, less the actual number of hours the surveyor is required to undertake that particular survey or inspection referred to in subparagraph (ii); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the services not determinable by the time involved, the relevant fee, if any, for the services specified in Part I or IV. (L.N. 82 of 2016)

subsection.content: The duration of a surveyor’s absence from Hong Kong shall be calculated with reference to the departure time and arrival time from and at Hong Kong.

Where part of the survey or inspection undertaken by a surveyor is done within Hong Kong and part of it is done outside Hong Kong, the fee payable for each part shall be calculated according to section 3 and this section respectively.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Fees for transmission of documents
section.content: Where in connection with any service specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule or the issue of a certificate, if any, specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule it is, in the opinion of the Authority, necessary to incur expense to transmit information, plans, calculations or other documents to places outside Hong Kong by post, telegram, telex, facsimile or similar means, there shall be payable in addition to the fee specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule the expense involved.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fees for services outside office hours
section.text: Except in the case of a service rendered by the Office, where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon any survey or inspection or where any other service is required to be undertaken by an officer of the Marine Department outside office hours, there shall be payable, in addition to the appropriate fee specified in this Regulation and the Schedule, if any, a fee in respect of each officer based upon the following scale—
section.leadIn:
On Monday to Friday (except a general holiday)— (L.N. 82 of 2016)
(a)
between the hours of 6:30 a.m. and 8:30 a.m. or 5:45 p.m. and 7:45 p.m.
｝
$1,115 per hour or part hour;
(b)
before 6:30 a.m. or after 7:45 p.m.
｝
$2,215 per hour or part hour;
On Saturday, Sunday or a general holiday
｝
$3,270 per hour or part hour: (L.N. 82 of 2016)
section.proviso: Provided that if 3 days’ notice of the requirement for any survey, or inspection or other service has been given to the Authority but notwithstanding such notice the Authority has caused the survey, or inspection or other service to be undertaken outside office hours, no such additional fee shall be payable.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Fees for miscellaneous services
section.leadIn: Where for any service other than a service for which a fee is specified in the Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where an officer of the Marine Department is required to visit a ship, shore installation, navigational aid or other site, the fee payable for each such visit during office hours shall be $3,270 for the first hour or part hour and $1,115 for each subsequent hour or part hour during which the visit continues; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee payable for such service in any other case during office hours shall be $1,115 for each hour or part hour during which the service continues.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Fees where service is not completed
section.content: Where, on the application of the owner or agent of a ship, work on any service in respect of that ship is undertaken by any officer of the Marine Department and, in consequence of any act of the owner or his agent, such work is abandoned before the completion thereof, there shall be payable such reasonable sum as the Authority may agree with the applicant, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Fees for issue of certificates of survey, etc.

subsection.content: Where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, consequent upon or pertaining to the carrying out of any service specified in Part I of the Schedule, otherwise than where the issue thereof is declared in that Part to be included in the service in question or where a fee for the issue thereof is specified in that Part, there shall be payable a fee of $565.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any copy of, or to make any alteration in, any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, in respect of which the original thereof was issued consequent upon or pertaining to the carrying out of any service specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule, whether such copy is required to be issued or such alteration made at the time of the issue of the original or not, there shall be payable— (L.N. 82 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee of $565 for each copy or alteration where no fee for the issue of the original is specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule or the issue of the original is declared in Part I or IV to be included in the service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fee equal to the amount of the fee specified in Part I or IV of the Schedule in any case in which a fee is specified therein for the issue of the original. (L.N. 82 of 2016)

subsection.content: No fee shall be payable for the issue of the duplicate of any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, in any case in which it is declared in Part I of the Schedule that such certificate, permit, approval, or document of authority, shall be issued in duplicate.

Where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any copy of, or make any alteration in, any licence, permit, certificate, or document of authority, issued in respect of or pertaining to any service specified in the Schedule, other than in Parts I and IV thereof, no fee shall be payable for the issue of such copy, or the making of such alteration, unless a fee therefor is so specified in which case such fee shall be payable. (L.N. 82 of 2016)

Where the Authority consents at the request of an applicant to supply a copy of, or to make any alteration to, any licence, permit, certificate, document or plan referred to in this Regulation, there shall be payable, in addition to the fees prescribed for such services therein, a handling charge of such reasonable sum in respect of such service as the Authority may agree with the applicant therefor, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Fees for attendance at legal proceedings or inquiries
section.leadIn: Where an officer of the Marine Department is required to attend, in his capacity as a Government official, any legal proceedings or inquiry in relation to any matter arising under the Ordinance, there shall be payable in respect thereof—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the attendance is in Hong Kong during office hours, a fee of $1,115 for each hour or part hour of attendance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the attendance is outside Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a fee of $7,645 for each period or part period of 24 hours during which the officer is absent from Hong Kong on account of the attendance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the travelling and subsistence expenses of the officer in such reasonable sums as the Authority shall determine.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Charges for advice and examination of plans
section.content: Where the Authority consents to survey, tender advice or examine plans in respect of the structure, machinery or equipment of a ship in so far as such structure, machinery or equipment is to comply with statutory requirements or with any other requirements and no fee for such survey, advice or examination is prescribed, there shall be payable such reasonable sum in respect of such survey, advice or examination as the Authority may agree with the applicant therefor, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Fees payable in advance
section.leadIn: Every fee shall be paid at the Marine Department in advance of the service in respect of which such fee is payable:
section.proviso: Provided that the Authority may in his discretion in any particular case permit any fee to be paid, in whole or in part, in arrear, and subject to such conditions as to security or time for payment as he may think fit.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Services required for certain official purposes

subsection.content: No fee shall be payable in respect of any copy of any certificate referred to in this Regulation which is supplied at the request of the representative of a government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region when the copy of a certificate is required for official purposes.

No fee specified in the Schedule shall be payable in respect of any service referred to in this Regulation which is performed at the request of any Hong Kong Government department or public body or the representative of any government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, but the Authority may make such charge in respect of the service rendered as he may consider appropriate.

part.name: PI

as to which, prior to the inspection, application is made in writing by or on behalf of the owner for that ship to be treated as a sister ship, accompanied by a declaration that it complies with the foregoing requirements.
The following fees shall be payable—
For the inspection of crew accommodation on first registry or re-registry in a ship not being a sister ship—
exceeding 50 tons but not exceeding 100 tons
exceeding 100 tons but not exceeding 500 tons
14,700 plus $4,425 for each 50 tons or part thereof exceeding 100 tons.
exceeding 500 tons but not exceeding 2 000 tons
49,930 plus $2,665 for each 100 tons or part thereof exceeding 500 tons.
exceeding 2 000 tons but not exceeding 30 000 tons
89,565 plus $5,515 for each 1 000 tons or part thereof exceeding 2 000 tons.

exceeding 50 tons but not exceeding 100 tons
exceeding 100 tons but not exceeding 500 tons
8,815 plus $3,325 for each 50 tons or part thereof exceeding 100 tons.
exceeding 500 tons but not exceeding 2 000 tons
35,280 plus $1,785 for each 100 tons or part thereof exceeding 500 tons.
exceeding 2 000 tons but not exceeding 30 000 tons

at the request of the owner or of any person being representative of the owners or of the crew of that ship

where the complaint is found to be justified
where the complaint is found not to be justified

units to increase pH value of water

For each sheet of a Rank Xerox (or similar) copy of a document provided by the Office

For any search of the Office records at request of applicant

This fee is for the attendance of an officer for one day only; it applies to the production of one document only (or one set). When several documents (or sets) have to be produced the fee is $535 a day for each document (or set) produced. (See Note to sub-item (g)). The fee is in addition to the fees payable for attendance by the officer under section 11 of this Regulation.
Travelling facilities must be provided by the person or persons requesting this service.

The fees under sub-items (a) to (e) are not charged to Hong Kong government departments or a department of the Central People’s Government or to consuls or other representatives of a government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region when the service required is for official purposes, except when a prolonged search is entailed, in which case the appropriate rate must be paid at the discretion of the Authority. (23 of 1998 s. 2; 64 of 1999 s. 3)
